title: Social Securty Mails Out Check To A Dead Woman

content: Social Security decided to declare my grandmother dead a few years BEFORE she died. The SS checks suddenly stopped coming. My mother called the SS office to try to fix it, and the idiot at the SS office said that my grandmother would have to come in for herself to prove that she's alive. My mother was flabbergasted, particularly because my grandmother was, at the time, suffering from Alzheimer's and very limited mobility and living in a nursing home in Canada (yes, she was an American citizen, she just retired to Canada). She was 91 years old at the time. There was no way she could have come to the social security office to say, "Hi, I'm not dead." My mother finally called our Senator and got it fixed.
reply: Social Security decided to declare my grandmother dead a few years BEFORE she died. The SS checks suddenly stopped coming. My mother called the SS office to try to fix it, and the idiot at the SS office said that my grandmother would have to come in for herself to prove that she's alive. My mother was flabbergasted, particularly because my grandmother was, at the time, suffering from Alzheimer's and very limited mobility and living in a nursing home in Canada (yes, she was an American citizen, she just retired to Canada). She was 91 years old at the time. There was no way she could have come to the social security office to say, "Hi, I'm not dead." My mother finally called our Senator and got it fixed.
title: Social Securty Mails Out Check To A Dead Woman

content: Years ago I heard a story about an old woman who ran a boarding house. She bumped of several of her tennants and burried 'em out back. Then she collected and cashed their social security checks. Got away with it for years.
